page.title: 18Fire Station, Martock
page.content: Twenty part time firemen work in the Fire Station and are called by a radio bleeping system. The firemen have to leave what they are doing at least 180 times a year. 6 firemen are in a fire engine at a time but there are only three breathing apparatus. If it is a house fire two applicances are sent but when it is a chimney fire or car fire only one appliance is sent. Sometimes when all three appliances at Yeovil are out at a fire, our appliances have to go to Yeovil. On each fire engine there is a water tender, ladder and a pump that will pump 2250 litres of water per minute. One of the ladders on the fire engine is 10.5 metres long and the other is 13.5 metres. In the fire engine they keep fittings for the 16 length hose that fits inside a compartment.
